CatDescriptText: Mrs. Clinton Saddler, 617 Devilliers Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Does the financial aid, given young married couples by parents, encourage or dissuade the latter's realization of marital responsibilities?" answer reads: "In most instances, it would depend on the educational background of the youngsters involved. Education gives a different slant on life."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Clinton Saddler, wearing eyeglasses and dark coat with single button at neck, standing in front of store windows, one on left with sign inscribed "Can you pick tomorrow's winners? Dow-Jones Industrial Stocks...1897, 1946, 1928, 1956", and one on right with display of eyeglasses

date: 617 Devilliers Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 30, 1957
cutline: In most instances, it would depend on the educational background of the youngsters involved. Education gives a different slant on life.
